comment: whisky gouté en 2014 chez mon ami Serge (Vitré) et qui est globalement très correct.
One of the first bottles given by my father. Was good, though I can't remember it much. Have to taste again.
Soft, and sweet, but no wow factor
Also tried the 93 bottling. Excellent finish
A good starter single malt. No real depth of flavor. Some nuts and honey with a slight hint of orange on the nose.

A rich taste but nice and smooth. It has enough flavour and slight depth to linger on the palette, it's a great choice for the regular tipple in the cupboard and a good choice to give someone put off by the stronger whiskeys.
Lots of citrus and fruit. Nice bourbon finish.
Nicht sehr rauchig, ein wenig langweilig im geschmack, von allem etwas aber nichts richtig
I didn't like that one. Very popular and rather cheap. Too spicy.

Nose: Rich, wood, toasted hazelnuts, fruits, brown sugar, chocolate. 
       Palate: Sweetness, crunchy nuts, smooth, fruity, brown sugar, espresso coffee, warming.   
    Finish: Medium to long, dry, sweet, nutty
Not bad. A little hot for my taste.
Simple and smooth. Not complex. Tasted third in a flight in St. Andrews. 9/2015
Ok - decent taste, smooth, good for start, balanced
Decent dram for after work. Get a nose of apples but not much else. Sweet and nice on the tongue, with a slightly peppery finish. Not complex but not bad for the price
Smooth liquid,  fairly  flavored with Apple and some bitterness. The experience is nice but too ordinary to leave you with strong memories
Apple and caramel, touch of floral honey. Light pepper on the finish.
Had a dram in Inverness. Really liked this one. Very rich. Opened up with a dab of water.
Smooth and gentle. With a bit of pepper on the finish. And the bottle looks really cool :) But this is about it - nothing else to remember and to come back to.
That one is a very good everyday relaxing dram. An apple burst with nutty and oaky nose, with a hint of sage, sweet warm palate and short, but warm finish.
Very flavorful but at the same time simple, smiith, and easy to drink. Go to for a slow drinker
Tasting at Nath's , good standard scotch.
Pleasant and sweet. Accessible to new whisky drinkers

I had this over a friend's place this past weekend.  Really easy sipping---reminded me a lot of Balvenie 12 double wood.  Nose is honey sweet, mouth equally sweet.  Finish is long and nutty.  I'm not sure how much this costs, but if it's less than a Balvenie 12, definately worth it as a value buy.
Toegankelijk, volle en romige smaak met peper in de afdronk.

Orchard fruit and hints of fresh oak on the nose. Medium bodied, with candied apple and almonds over the palate. The finish nutty, slightly dry and of medium length. Balanced and tasty, but perhaps a little one dimensional for the seasoned whisky drinker. Nevertheless, it is palatable and fairly priced for an introductory scotch ($58 CAD). Worth a try.
dit is die platte fles in Ermelo, heeft er lang gestaan omdat er toch steeds andere waren die me meer trokken.
It has fruit and vanilla, but it isn’t overly sweet and is pleasantly smooth without much burn. Though it isn’t my favorite style, it’s good.
Outstanding!  Lots of orange zest on the palate that finishes with a honey sweetness and long aroma of cereal, hay and fresh flowers.  Incredibly smooth, well structured and balanced.
Very fruity, almost loses the scotch flavor
Pleasant enough whisky. Caramel, sherry, lots of oak, dried fruit, damson and apples on the nose. Taste could be fuller and rounder. Slightly peaty finish which did linger a while.

neutraler Geruch 
etwas schärfe auf der Zunge 
sonst mild
Мне аромат показался очень цветочным,  луговым,  сбалансированным и легким. Лично для меня - самый питкий виски.
Strong caramel on the nose, with a hint of orange. Malt flavour dominates the tongue, but some sweetness comes  through in the form of caramel and honey notes. Finish is somewhat empty

The truly great drinkable whisky I've tasted!!! Thanks to my oldest brother at my 1st year nephew :D #hics 
Although I tasted the Spey Cascade.

One of those whiskies where you think “oh, this is good, it is good!” but at the end of the day you are like - hm, that’s good indeed, but I want more, I need more. 
All in all, good whiskey for occasional drinking, also a good gift to friends when you visit them.
clear cooper colour, smooth citric, some, vanilla, oak and a bit of smoke, spicy but not so long end.

Nez classique de Speyside, sur la poire caramélisée, assez sec.
Attaque douce mais agréable, sur le caramel.
Corps moyennement présent mais agréable.
Long en bouche, très présent sur les papilles, sympa mais pas transcendant.
Mellow, fruity, with a sweet finish.
Not my kind of whisky. Boring and thin. Harsh alcohol taste, too much for a 40%. I use this to 'flambé' now.
Light with oak, honey, light floral spice and acidic tree fruit/citrus. Easily forgettable. $60 in Ontario.
Perfectly balanced, matured in combination of EU/US oak casks. Nutty aroma, rich fruity taste, lingering finish
Fairly complex aroma. Nutty and spicy with a lingering finish.

Olfato: cítrico, mel, baunilha, laranja, limão e presença marcante do carvalho.

Paladar: dulçor, notas cítricas, picância, mel, baunilha e álcool. Basicamente as mesmas notas detectadas no olfato.

Finalização: curta com algum dulçor vindo à tona.

Impressões gerais: whisky simples, indicado para coquetéis ou beber com gelo. Apesar de ser um puro malte que estampa seus 12 anos no rótulo, o álcool no aroma e paladar ainda é muito presente, sendo necessário, ao menos, um pouco de gelo para amenizar toda a agressividade deste whisky.
Strong, almost harsh on the first sip, then smooths out quite evenly. Medium smokey-ness, almost just right, those casks do wonders. After a few rounds, it's even better.

This one really didn't sit well with me. I tried it along with a tullibardine sovereign, highland magnus, glenlivet captains reserve. This one was the odd man out.
I picked up a lot of heavy wood and smoke and was just rough all around. I will give it another shot but I fear this might be a mixer for me, or an orange peel at least. Regular price is $50 something CAD.
キリッとしていてるが、癖はなく飲みやすい。
Ook weer zo’n lekkere the singleton

On the nose,strong alcohol with intense Oak and sweetness,nothing more. On the palate very present oak, with a sweet sugary taste, fruity, with a good toasted bitterness lightly noted finish. No vanilla no caramel and no floral notes, very straight forward wooden sweet character. Nice for a change.

Nothing special, but nothing bad ether.

No peat, sherry and Apple in the nose.

Sweet and fruity on palate, as well as a Little spicy.

Finish quite Short and spicy, warmth stays a Little bit
Easy drinking. A little smoky with fruits.

Picked up on sale usually 75, purchased for 55.

Easy drinker which mild Smokey notes
Easy on the nose, but a very heavy finish
Moja pierwsza whisky single malt. Delikatna
Delikatny w smaku, z lodem gładko wchodzi, także z całą reszta też będzie smakowal
Simple, much wood with some vanilla

Tatlı koku (üzüm?)
Baharatlı bir tat

Just a little bit sweet taste. Very nice.

Sweet, nutty, smooth.
Nose: vanilla sweetness, some citrus.
Palate: smooth, balanced. Sweetness and nutty elements.
Aftertaste: sweet, nutty,  medium. First not too spicy, but after a few sips it is getting more spicy, less sweet.
A bit shy, yet floral enough to keep you interested in diving into single malts. An unfulfilled, but intriguing promise.
Sweet, woody smell with hints of Vanilla. Taste smooth sweeter not strong alcohol. Can't taste any particulat taste, yet.

Un classique du Speyside pour un prix extrêmement raisonnable.
Doux et fruité, légèrement fumé, parfait en dégustation ou pour accompagner un repas. 
Bouteille très originale de par sa forme ! A avoir chez soi !
There is not much really going on here. Medium body, Vanilla on the nose, weak on the palate. Finish short. Not bad but not great.
